name: Heavy Duty: Shoulders & Arms
description: Mentzer's shoulder and arm routine. Pre-exhaust delts with lateral raises, then press. Arms get supersetted for maximum pump with minimum volume. Short, intense, effective.

exercises.notes: LATERAL RAISE: Strict form, no swinging. Pause at top. 4-2-4 tempo. To FAILURE.
SHOULDER PRESS: Immediately (no rest). Delts pre-fatigued = shoulders fail before triceps. To FAILURE.
1 set to failure. Squeeze shoulder blades together. 4-2-4 tempo.
BICEPS: Full range of motion. Squeeze at top. 4-2-4 tempo. To FAILURE.
TRICEPS: Immediately (no rest). Lock out fully. 4-2-4 tempo. To FAILURE.
Only if you have more. Rest-pause if needed: hit failure, rest 10 sec, continue to failure again.
Same technique. 1 more superset, both to failure.

tips: Lateral raises: keep strict form - if you're swinging, the weight is too heavy
Pre-exhaust on shoulders means you'll use less weight on press - that's the point
Arms superset = biceps to failure, immediately triceps to failure. No rest.
REST-PAUSE technique: at failure, rest 10 sec, continue until failure again
Total arm volume is only 2-4 sets - but each set is 100% effort
